speeches.title: How to speak so that people want to listen
speeches.speaker: Julian Treasure
speeches.description: Have you ever felt like you're talking, but nobody is listening? Here's Julian Treasure to help you fix that. As the sound expert demonstrates some useful vocal exercises and shares tips on how to speak with empathy, he offers his vision for a sonorous world of listening and understanding.
speeches.filename: How to speak so that people want to listen _ Julian Treasure.mp4

speeches.title: How to tie your shoes
speeches.speaker: Terry Moore
speeches.description: Terry Moore found out he'd been tying his shoes the wrong way his whole life. In the spirit of TED, he takes the stage to share a better way. (Historical note: This was the very first 3-minute audience talk given from the TED stage, in 2005.)
speeches.filename: How to tie your shoes _ Terry Moore.mp4

speeches.title: On Surviving A Bear Encounter
speeches.speaker: Mike Birbiglia
speeches.description: Mike Birbiglia jokes about facing his fear of bears in Alaska's Katmai National Park.
speeches.filename: On Surviving A Bear Encounter _ Mike Birbiglia.mp4

speeches.title: This is what happens when you reply to spam email
speeches.speaker: James Veitch
speeches.description: Suspicious emails: unclaimed insurance bonds, diamond-encrusted safe deposit boxes, close friends marooned in a foreign country. They pop up in our inboxes, and standard procedure is to delete on sight. But what happens when you reply? Follow along as writer and comedian James Veitch narrates a hilarious, months-long exchange with a spammer who offered to cut him in on a hot deal.
speeches.filename: This is what happens when you reply to spam email _ James Veitch.mp4

speeches.title: The surprising habits of original thinkers
speeches.speaker: Adam Grant
speeches.description: How do creative people come up with great ideas? Organizational psychologist Adam Grant studies 'originals': thinkers who dream up new ideas and take action to put them into the world.
speeches.filename: The surprising habits of original thinkers _ Adam Grant.mp4
